title: Chilli Idli Recipe
description: Chilli Idli is a very delicious Indo Chinese recipe which you can serve as a starter. It is a quick and easy recipe, making it a great option to include in the menu at any party.

steps.to_do: You can use leftover idli or you can also use fresh idli to make chilli idli.
Take idlis and cut them into desired shape. Make a thin batter by mixing corn starch, all purpose flour, salt, pepper and ginger garlic paste in a bowl.
Heat oil in a pan, coat the idlis well in the batter and fry them in oil till they turn crispy golden.
After this, heat oil in another pan, add finely chopped garlic, green chili and onion and fry it lightly.
Add capsicum, black pepper and a little salt to it. Now add red chili sauce, ketchup, vinegar and soy sauce to it.
Cook all these things for few seconds. Add corn starch liquid to it and mix. After this add fried idli and mix it well. Serve garnished with green onions.

title: Khas Khas And Gud Ki Panjiri Recipe

image.alt: Khas Khas And Gud Ki Panjiri

description: Panjiri is a sweet recipe that is rich, delicious and one of the most comforting foods that can help us wade through those freezing days ahead. This grainy sweet packs a punch of healthfulness and is said to build immunity,

steps.to_do: Heat pan, when hot add white sesame seeds and roast until golden brown
Heat pan again and add ¼ of ghee and fry above frying ingredients, one by one keep aside.
Fine chop cashew nut, almond, raisins.
Heat pan and roast wheat flour till brown.
Add remaining ghee in a pan. When ghee melts add chopped dry fruits, green cardamom. Than add wheat flour, roasted and all ingredients.
When hot add crushed jaggery. Remove from fire and mix well. Panjiri is ready.

title: Nalli Ka Salan Recipe
description: Hyderbadi Nalli ka salan is a traditional dish prepared on special occasions. It is a spicy dish served with Rice and Roti. The Nalli pieces are cooked with spices and to thicken the gravy they add coconut paste which gives the texture to the gravy.

steps.to_do:
For dry powder- Dry red chilli, mace, Fennel Seeds, Cinnamon, Cardamom, Clove, Curry leaves and
Dry Copra. Dry Roast and make it into a fine powder and lastly keep it aside,
Clean the Lamb Shanks and keep aside.
Take a pan, add oil and saute onion until golden brown then add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree. Add the dry roast powder, turmeric powder and stir well.
Add lamb Shanks then add hot water and bring it to boil.
Now, add curd and cook the shanks well.
Once shanks are cooked, take the shanks out of the gravy and keep aside.
Now strain the gravy finely. Then add back the shanks and cook for some time.
Place it in a bowl and garnish it with juliennes of ginger and chopped coriander.
In a bowl add maida, salt, sugar, some oil, curd and water to knead a soft dough. Pat with some oil and let this rest for around 2 hours.
In a pan heat some oil; add ginger garlic paste, minced meat and onions.
Cook for some time and then add the powdered spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, haldi, red chilli powder and salt according to taste.
Once the keema is almost cooked, add coriander leaves and take off the heat.
Get the dough and section into 4. Make thick medium sized rotis and add the stuffing in them.
Pinch all sides together and roll with light hands.
To bake cook 50% on a pan and then add to a pre heated oven.
To cook in tawa, lightly flip on both sides until golden brown and cooked.
Brush with coriander and garlic butter and enjoy with a dip of your choice.

title: Palak Vada Recipe
description: As the name suggests, this vada recipe is made with addition of palak (spinach) and the goodness of dry fenugreek leaves, piquant flavours of green chillies and ginger along with spices like cumin seeds, red chilli powder, dry mango powder and more.

steps.to_do: Take a grinder, add soaked (soaked at least for 4 hours) chana dal and grind it until a thick paste.
Then take out the blended paste in a bowl, add fenugreek leaves, cumin seeds, green chillies, ginger garlic paste and other dry ingredients.
Mix everything well. Add a little amount of water (if required).
Take small portion out of the batter one by one. Heat oil in a kadhai and deep fry them.
Pair these winter special vadas with ketchup, mint or tamarind chutney.

title: Jalebi Churros Recipe
description: Jalebi lovers can definitely gorge on this delicious fusion of Jalebis and churros, topped with luscious rabri. End your lavish meal on a perfect note with this recipe.

steps.to_do: Firstly for rabri, take a pan and add full cream milk into it. Afterwards add saffron, sugar, khoya and reduce till 1/4 of mixture is left.
Secondly, For churros take a sauce pan and add water, alongside butter, sugar, vanilla essence. Later boil it and add refined flour to make dough. Lastly add egg and mix it well.
Make churros with the help of a piping bag and set it in the fridge.
Fry churros till golden brown then place it on a plate. Sprinkle some cinnamon sugar, put in rabri and garnish with chopped dry nuts.

title: Aloo Do Pyaza Recipe
description: A hearty aloo recipe with generous amount of crunchy onions, tomato paste and a burst of aromatic spices.

steps.to_do: Heat some oil in a pan. Lightly fry the diced onions, tomatoes and potatoes. Keep aside.
In the same pan, saute cumin seeds.
Add chopped onion, green chilli, and ginger-garlic paste.
When onions cook, add salt to taste, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder. Mix well.
Add fried potatoes and mix well.
Add some water, cover the pan and let the potatoes cook for some time.
Lastly, add fried onions and tomatoes. Mix and serve.

title: Paneer Masala Fry Recipe
description: This paneer masala fry is packed with a punch of masalas that gives you an explosion of taste in every bite.

steps.to_do: Cut the paneer in small cubes.
Now in a bowl add red chilli powder, pepper, garam masalas, turmeric powder, coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste and mix.
Now add thick curd and combine it with the masalas. Finally add some lemon drops.
Throw in the paneer cubes and make sure that all the pieces are coated well. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
In a pan, heat some oil, add curry leaves, dry red chilli and let it splutter.
Put in the paneer pieces and cook from both the sides.
When it turns brown and crispy take it out and serve!

title: Gud Til Ladoo Recipe
description: These laddus made in winter are not only delicious and also keep your health in check. Consumption of sesame and jaggery in winter is very beneficial. It helps to keep you warm from inside.

steps.to_do: First of all, roast sesame seeds in a pan and keep them aside to cool down. Then, place a wok on the gas and heat it by adding ghee.
Add jaggery to it and let it melt completely. Slow down the flame.
After melting the jaggery, add sesame seeds, cardamom powder, crushed almonds and cashews and mix it well.
Now turn off the gas. After the mixture cools down a bit, grease your hands and make laddus from it.
Keep these laddoos in an airtight container and enjoy them.

title: Egg Samosa Recipe
description: This samosa recipe is stuffed with a masala mixture of carrots, potatoes and eggs, making it crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

steps.to_do: In a bowl mix together maida, baking powder and salt. Add onion seeds and oil. Knead into a smooth dough. Allow it to rest for 1-2 hours.
Heat oil in a pan and then saute the onions and green chillies until onions turn golden-pink. Add the grated potatoes and carrots. Stir-fry for a minute.
Add salt, and coriander leaves. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or till the potatoes are soft and mushy.
Now break the eggs into the pan and cook until the eggs are done. Remove from fire and allow it to cool.
Make small balls of the dough and roll them into thin and small chapatis.
Place the egg mixture and shape them into small/medium triangles. Seal the edges with little water.
Deep fry the prepared samosas in small batches until golden brown. Remove and drain excess oil.
Serve hot with ketchup, onion rings and the chutney of your choice!

title: Poha Chaat Recipe
description: This recipe of poha chaat will surely be a unique zing in the taste that you need to try! This easy chaat recipe requires essential home ingredients only.

steps.to_do: In a pan dry roast poha and take it out. Then in the same pan roast peanuts, curry leaves, urad dal, cashews and almonds.
Once done mix the poha and other rasted ingredients.
Now throw in chopped onions, cucumber, tomatoes and mix again.
Finally add, red chilli powder, pepper, salt as per taste.
Now add a table spoon of imly chutney.
Finally garnish it with coriander leaves and serve it in a bowl.

title: Butter Chicken Pasta Recipe
description: This butter chicken pasta brings the best of both worlds, the spicy and aromatic flavours of Indian with the deliciousness of the Italian.
ingredients: 4-5  Boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite size pieces
A pinch of Orange food color, optional
1 and a half cup Finely chopped onion

steps.to_do: Marinate the chicken for 4-6 hours.

Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When hot, add chicken in a single layer, cook for about 2 minutes, turn over and continue cooking for additional 2 minutes. Remove chicken into a bowl (chicken will not be fully cooked at this point).
Reduce heat to medium, add butter to the same skillet and let melt. Add cumin seeds and let sizzle for few seconds.
Stir in chopped onion, crushed garlic, ginger and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring often, until onions get golden brown color (4-5 minutes).
Add kasuri methi, coriander powder, cayenne and garam masala powder. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until spices are toasted well (don't let it burn).

Add tomato sauce, cashew powder and chicken (along with all accumulated juices), stir well, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 10 minutes (stirring every 3-4 minutes to make sure that it does not burn in the bottom).
Add cooked pasta and toss well.

title: Matar Samosa Recipe
description: In this recipe, the classic aloo filling is replaced with fresh matar that is cooked in spices. Then small samosas are made and enjoyed. This quick and easy recipe can be made with just a few ingredients.
ingredients: 1 and a half cup Fresh Peas

steps.to_do: To make the dough, take all-purpose flour, salt, ghee, water and mix. Make a dough and let it rest.
Till then, prepare the stuffing. For that add oil in a pan and throw in cumin seeds, slit green chilli and green peas. Mix it well.
Now add spices like red chilli powder, coriander powder, amchur powder, garam masala and salt. Combine again.
Once done let this mixture cool down.
Now, from the dough make, bite size samosa shapes, fill in the stuffing and deep fry them till crisp.
Once done, take them out and enjoy!

title: Rajasthani Haldi Sabzi Recipe
description: For you to indulge in the maximum benefits of turmeric this year, here we bring you a recipe of Rajasthani haldi sabzi!

steps.to_do: Wash and chop haldi in smaller pieces.
Then in a pan, heat some oil and add ginger garlic paste, slit green chilli and mix.
Then throw in the chopped haldi. Let it cook.
Then in a bowl, add curd, red chilli powder, coriander powder, pepper and salt and mix.
After five minutes, pour the dahi mixture in the sabzi and cook.
Keep stirring it occasionally.
When the oil starts to separate, the sabzi is almost ready.
You can take it out and serve it in a bowl to enjoy!

title: Chana Dal Chikki Recipe
description: Chana Dal chikki is just another version of the classic peanut chikki but much flavourful and rich. The use of roasted Bengal grams adds an earthy flavor to the chikki along with the nutty taste that we all love.

steps.to_do: In a kadhai, dry roast chana dal until it smells done and starts changing color to slightly golden.
In another pan heat ghee and add jaggery to it, mix until properly melted.
Add the roasted chana dal to the jaggery and mix until every piece has been coated with jaggery. Take off the heat and quickly transfer to a well-greased flat surface.
Let this set for 2-4 hours and enjoy.

title: Atthe Mutton Curry Recipe
description: Made completely in pure desi ghee and an iron pan, the Atthe Mutton Curry has a distinct taste and an enticing colour. The richness of the ghee seeps into the mutton pieces and make them tender and succulent, pair it with a plate of fluffy white rice for your next indulgent spread.

steps.to_do: Use low to medium heat throughout the recipe. In an Iron kadhai, add ghee and hing. Add whole spices and cook for a while. Add mutton pieces and cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Add sliced onions and stir and keep cooking until the onions are soft.
Add salt and cover for another 5 minutes. Add haldi and red chilli powder and cook for another 5 minutes.
Make a paste of garlic, ginger, black peppercorns and green chillies. Add it to the mutton at this point.
Mix everything well and keep cooking. Keep stirring every 5 minutes to make sure the masala doesn’t stick.
The mutton will start releasing water, let this water and ghee mix cook together.
Cover and cook the mutton until soft. Sprinkle some water after every 5 minutes when you stir the mutton.
Once done, serve hot with fluffy white rice.

title: Chole Samosa Chaat Recipe
description: Chole samosa chaat is made with crispy smashed samosa, layered with spicy chole (chickpea curry), tangy sauces, dahi, and a host of other spices.
ingredients: 1 and a half cup All Purpose Flour

steps.to_do: Firstly, knead a dough by using all purpose flour. Once done, set aside.
Then for the samosa filling, mash potatoes and add all the dry ingredients mentioned in the ingredients list above.
Take a small portion from the dough, roll it out, and fill it with aloo mixture.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the samosas.
To assemble the chaat, smash the samosa, pour chole over it along with chutneys and dahi.
Sprinkle some pomegranate kennels, sev and garnish with coriander leaves
Your chaat is ready!

title: Kerala Egg Curry Recipe
description: Kerala Egg curry, also known as Mutta curry, is made with tomatoes, onions, spices, coconut milk, and eggs.

steps.to_do: Add oil in a pan and heat it.
Now add mustard seeds and onions and ginger garlic paste.
Cook till onions are soft. Now add tomato puree, and cook it.
Next, throw in masalas like red chilli powder, pepper, turmeric powder, garam masala and salt. Mix them well.
Take boiled eggs, slit them from middle and add it in the pan. Let all the flavours combine.
Add a dash of coconut milk and let it boil.

title: Kariwari Chicken Curry Recipe
description: Named after the city of Karwar, this chicken curry is inspired by the coastal flavours of the coconut. The chicken is marinated in a paste made of red chillies, coriander seeds and garlic and later on cooked in spicy and aromatic masalas.
ingredients: 15  Dry Red Chillies (Bedgi variety, if available)

steps.to_do: Roast the chillies, coriander seeds and the garlic with a little oil for 2 minutes and once it cools down grind it to a fine paste.
Apply this paste to the chicken and marinate for at least half an hour.
Roast the coconut and onion in the same pan with little oil until light brown in colour.
Roast the rest of the spices gently till they release their aroma, cool down to room temperature and grind to a fine paste along with the roasted coconut and onions.
Heat oil in a vessel, add the finely chopped onions and sauté till they turn translucent.
Add the marinated chicken and fry for 5 minutes until the oils are released.
Add the ground coconut-onion paste, and sauté for 3-4 minutes until the chicken, the coconut onion masala and the spices come together.
Add 1 litre of water, salt, cover and cook on a slow flame till the chicken is cooked. The consistency of this gravy can be made to your liking.

title: Quinoa And Sabudana Kesari Bath Recipe
description: This recipe is a delicious and healthy dessert that is also very easy and quick to make. It can be a perfect option to prepare for any special occasion, festival or gatherings.

steps.to_do: Rinse the quinoa and sabudana in cold water using a fine mesh to remove all dirt.
Bring 1 cup of water to a rolling boil and add ¼ cup of quinoa. Reduce the flame to low. Cover the pan and cook the quinoa for 25 minutes and then fluff with a fork.
Bring 4 cups of water to soak the sabudana ¼ cup for 1 hour.

Heat 1-teaspoon ghee in a pan, fry cashews until golden. When done; remove from the pan, add the cooked quinoa and soaked sabudana, and roast for few seconds. Now add 1 cup water and mix well. Allow it to boil well with lid on in medium flame. This should take about 8 to 10 minutes.
When the quinoa and sabudana look cooked and dry, add kesar. Mix well.
Add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well and add ghee and fried cashews. When the mixture blends, switch off the flame and serve.

title: Bread Dahi Chaat Recipe
description: We bring you an easy and delicious recipe of bread Dahi chaat! As the name suggests, this chaat is made with a mix of crispy bread, and the classic flavours of chaat to give you a zing in the taste!

steps.to_do: Take five to six pieces of bread and cut them in small bite size pieces.
Now you can either choose to bake it or pan fry it till crispy.
Once it is done let it come till room temperature and then add it to a bowl.
To this, now add yoghurt, green chutney, imly chutney, boiled potatoes and boiled chana. Mix again.
Next, add spices like pepper, red chilli powder, chaat masala and salt as per taste and combine again.
Lastly, add pomegranate and sev or bhujia from the top to relish!

title: Bread Medu Vada  Recipe
description: As the name suggests, these vadas are quickly made with bread and other ingredients that completes the dish. And trust us, the bread medu vada has a similar taste to the regular vadas, so you would hardly notice any difference in flavour!

steps.to_do: Take a bowl and add mashed potato, chopped pieces of bread, suji, rice flour, yoghurt, jeera, ginger paste, red chilli powder, salt and pepper as per taste.
Combine all these well and form a dough-like consistency.
Now, take small roundels of this dough and give it a shape of vada.
Next, deep fry these vadas till crisp and golden.
Once done, take it out and serve to enjoy!

title: 3-Ingredient Onion Pickle Recipe
description: Making an achar seems to be a challenging task, but trust us, the recipe of onion achar is so easy, quick and requires just 3 ingredients.

steps.to_do: Take two red onions and slice them thinly. Add this to a jar or bowl.
Now add warm water and make sure the onions submerge in it.
To this add white vinegar and sea salt. Mix it all properly so that the flavors combine.
Keep it in the refrigerator till it gets cold and then serve to enjoy!

title: Dahi Samosa Chaat Recipe
description: Made with rich freshly grounded spices, crispy aloo samosa and a lot of dahi, this chaat is surely to die for.

steps.to_do: Firstly, prepare the knead by using maida, carrom seeds, salt and water. Set it aside for at least 15 minutes.
Mash some boiled potatoes along with matar, green chillies and all the dry spices. Mix everything well.
Now, take a small portion from the dough, roll it and stuff it with the aloo filling. Seal all the sides and drop them into the kadhai of hot oil. Fry until the samosa turns crispy and golden.
Transfer the samosa on a plate, pour beaten curd, chutneys, sprinkle some chaat masala, coriander leaves and sev on the top.
Your samosa chaat is ready to relish

title: Adrak Ka Achar Recipe
description: Here we bring you a delicious four-ingredient instant adrak achar that you can make in just 15 minutes!

steps.to_do: Grate one whole ginger and add it to a bowl.
Now to this, add a bit of salt, lemon juice and chopped green chillies and mix.
Once the colour turns pink, refrigerate it and have it with any meal.

title: Idli Dhokla Recipe
description: Till now you must have had idli and dhokla as separate dishes. But to give you a twist of taste, here we have a delicious recipe of idli dhokla that you'll love to devour.

steps.to_do: Mix besan, rava, ginger, curd, heeng, oil, salt, sugar, chopped chillies and water in a bowl. Once combined, add some fruit salt and whisk again.
Pour this batter in a idli stand and steam it.
For the tempering take some water, sugar and salt and pur it from above.
When the idli dhoklas soak in the water add some grated coconut and mustard seeds from the top.

title: Mutton Sukka Recipe
description: Mutton Sukka can be eaten any way you want. Some people have it as an evening snack to offer to parties guests, others have it for Sunday lunch with rasam and rice.

steps.to_do: Take a pressure cooker and add the mutton, turmeric powder, salt, little oil and water. Pressure cook up to 4 whistles till mutton is tender. Alternatively, add all the items in a pan and cover & cook for around 45 mins till meat is tender.

Heat oil in a pan & add the shallots. Fry on medium heat for 1-2 mins and add the slit green chillies and curry leaves. Continue to fry on medium heat for another 5-6 mins till the shallots are translucent and light brown at the edges.
Now add the Ginger Garlic paste and fry on low heat for 2 mins.
Add the boiled mutton along with the stock and give a mix. Bring to a boil.
Take a pan and add all the spices to make the masala powder. Dry roast on low heat for 2-3 mins. Set aside to cool and grind to a coarse powder.
Add the masala powder made in the grinder earlier and give a mix.
Fry this on high heat for around 6-7 mins till all the stock is absorbed and the mutton is fried and becomes dark in colour. - Check and add salt for seasoning if needed at this stage.
Add the chopped coriander leaves and fry on high heat for 1-2 mins till oil separates.

title: Chicken Kondattam Recipe
description: Chicken Kodattam is just the quick chicken starter you need to spruce all your boring meals, it is spicy, slurpy and South Indian, what else could we ask for? Try it out!

steps.to_do: In a bowl take the chicken, add lime juice, some salt, 2 tbsp. red chilli powder, ½ tsp black pepper powder, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, cornflour and mix well.
Make sure the chicken is coated properly with the mixture.
Let this sit for at least 30 minutes. After which, fry the chicken pieces for around 4 minutes on both sides in low flame.
In another pan, add curry leaves, dried red chilli, ginger garlic paste, onions and fry until the onions are pinkish brown.
Now add the remaining red chilli powder, black pepper powder, Haldi and salt.
Mix everything well and add soy sauce or ketchup whichever is available.
Once the masala is soft, you may add water if it looks too dry.
Toss in the fried chicken, coat the masala well and let this cook for another 5-10 minutes. Garnish with some fresh curry leaves and chopped chillies and serve hot.

title: Homemade Bread Gulab Jamun Recipe
description: A traditional sweet, gulab jamun is one of the most loved sweet (mithai) in India. This homemade Gulab jamun is made from bread, malai and milk powder. It is not only delicious but also very easy-to-make. Try it out!

steps.to_do: Take bread slices and grind them to make fresh breadcrumbs.
Add malai and milk powder to this and mash lightly.
Now add milk in small batches and knead a soft dough.
Make tiny dough balls out of this and keep aside on a plate.
Heat ghee/neutral oil in a pan and fry the dough balls in batches.
Lightly shallow fry until the balls are golden brown.
While you are frying the dough balls, in another pan heat a cup of water.
Add the sugar and stir until slightly thick, add crushed cardamom pods and Kesar strands.
Let the sugar syrup come to a rolling boil then take off the heat.
Now add the fried dough balls to the sugar syrup, serve hot or cold according to your preference.

title: Choco-Elaichi Peda Recipe
description: If you love chocolate then you will definitely like this choco-elaichi peda. This is a quick & easy dessert, try it at home on the occasion of rakshabandhan.

steps.to_do: In a food processor add Marie biscuits & crush finely.
Take the crushed biscuit in a mixing bowl & add Chocolate Flavoured Syrup, condensed milk & cardamom powder.
Mix the ingredients thoroughly to form a dough.
Apply butter or ghee on your palms and divide the mixture into equal portions.
Form smooth round balls & flatten them to resemble Peda.
Tuck in the desiccated coconut & pistachios in the centre of the Peda.
Refrigerate and use.

title: Nuts Barfi Recipe
description: Nut Barfi is a amazing recipe to celebrate the festival of Rakshabandhan.You Can make this barfi with few ingredients. On this Rakshabandhan make this barfi at home and give a surprise to your brother.
ingredients: 1/2 cups sesame paste (toasted sesame ground, like tahini)

steps.to_do: In a heavy bottom pan, add ghee to heat a little.
To the ghee, add cashew powder, sesame paste and chopped nuts. Cook all this together till the moisture evaporates, but beware not to brown the mixture.
Add Strawberry Flavoured Syrup and cook till its combined and semi dry.
Place barfi trays on your work platform and tip the mixture into the trays enough to fill the trays evenly.
For garnish sprinkle Pista on the tray. Overturn the tray, on your worktable, and turn it back to let the Pistas stick into the halwa.
Set the hallway for a 3 - 4 hours.
Cut the halwa into bite sized squares, plate & garnish with some more Pista.

title: Lauki Roti Recipe
description: Detox roti is a combination of atta and vegetable. Full of moisture, lauki helps keep your body hydrated and cool. Try out this lauki roti recipe today!

steps.to_do: Add lauki and atta to a bowl.
Use your hands and knead the dough.
Then roll your rotis by using a roller and cook them on a tawa from both the sides.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Diabetic-Friendly Rabri Recipe
description: Made with the goodness of oats, orange and jaggery, this recipe is not only delicious but also very healthy. This Rabri recipe is made specially for diabetic people.

steps.to_do: Sautee the oats in ghee for 2 minutes.
Add milk to oats and mix well. Let it cook for 10 minutes.
Once the oats has thickened, remove it from flame. Let it cool down.
Add the orange segments and sugar substitute to oats mixture, mix well.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Garnish with chopped almonds.

title: Aloo Poha Recipe
description: This recipe is as simple as it can get. This is for the lazy day's when you wake up late and don't feel like cooking anything. All you need to do is wash some poha, add boiled potatoes along with flavourful spices, mix it together and this simple delicacy is ready to relish!

steps.to_do: Heat oil in a pan and saute mustard seeds, onions, curry leaves, peanuts and green chillies.
Once the onions are translucent, add potatoes, haldi and salt(according to taste).
Wash your poha, drain it and add it to the pan. Mix well. Keep on flame till its cooked.
Once the poha is ready, garnish it with coriander and lemon juice.

title: Paneer tikka toast Recipe
description: Paneer tikka is one of those dishes that people love to have. This paneer tikka toast will surely be your number one recipe in no time.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Roughly chopped onion and capsicum

steps.to_do: In a large bowl mix curd, besan, and all the spices. Combine these and then add paneer, onion and capsicum. Keep it aside for 10 minutes.
Heat some oil in a pan and then add the marinated paneer. Let it cook till golden brown.
Then on bread add the paneer tikka and grill the bread.
Serve with mint chutney and tomato ketchup.

title: Jhajariya Recipe
description: Jhajariya is a pudding/halwa which is made with tender sweet corn powder. The use of ghee and milk brings a unique flavor to this dish, it feels creamy and rich; the added nuts give it a crunch and make it a wholesome dessert you can whip up in no time.

steps.to_do: Take the sweet corn and make a fine powder out of it.
In a pan heat ghee and roast the corn powder until slightly golden brown.
Add 1 cup milk and let it cook for 5 minutes. If you feel the milk has been soaked up, use more milk.
The consistency should be soft like a halwa. Not dry, not liquidy. Adjust milk according to this.
Add sugar and let it cook for another 2 mins.
Sprinkle cardamom powder and take off the heat.
Garnish with raisins, nuts, and Kesar strands. Serve hot.

title: Chinese Idli Recipe
description: Chinese Idli is an interesting and innovative Indo-Chinese recipe. Made with Idli chunks and chopped veggies followed by some tempting sauces, this quick and easy recipe can be a perfect snack and even appetizer.

steps.to_do: Sauté onions in a saucepan.
Add ginger, garlic, green chilli, bell pepper and stir.
Season with tomato ketchup, red chilli sauce, soya sauce, vinegar, sugar, red chilli powder and mix well.
Add the idlis to the sauce and stir till the idlis are bathed in the sauce.
Serve it piping hot!

title: Varo mithai  Recipe
description: Varo is a Sindhi dessert usually made for festivals like Diwali, but its richness and flavour makes it a sough-after dish at any time of the year.

steps.to_do: In a pan roast the chopped dry fruits until lightly charred. Take them off the heat and keep it aside.
In the same pan add ghee and poppy seeds and mix for a minute.
Now add sugar and let it caramelize. Make sure there are no lumps; stir it continuously until a smooth melted liquid forms.
Switch off the flame and immediately add the chopped dry fruits.
Mix everything together and be quick because the sugar will start to solidify.
Apply a drop of ghee on a flat surface like a plate and grease it. Pour the sugar and dry fruits mixture and gently tap until it is well dispersed.

Once it is spread evenly, cut it into medium-sized squares. Since it is still soft right now, it will be easier to cut into uniformed pieces. You can avoid this step and break it into pieces once it solidifies as well.
Serve as is or you can even store for up to 2 weeks in an airtight container.

title: Sweet Potato Shrikhand Recipe
description: The texture of the sweet potato gives this Shrikhand a creamy and thick feel, the sweetness of honey enhance the flavour and there is nothing better than curd to blend all this good stuff together.
ingredients: 1 cup Boiled/roasted and peeled sweet potatoes
4 tbsp Honey/ sweetener of your choice

steps.to_do: Prepare hung curd by straining regular dahi and letting the entire extra water drop.
In a bowl, mix hung curd and honey or the sweetener of your choice.
Take the sweet potato and either boil it or slightly roast it until it is soft and mushy.
Peel the sweet potato and make small pieces.
In a blender, add curd mixture and sweet potato and blend into a thick creamy paste.
Serve topped with chopped dry fruits and kesar.
For best results, let it chill for an hour and then devour.

title: Achari Paneer Paratha Recipe
description: Try this unique paratha recipe in your breakfast or lunch- this dish will win the hearts of your family. You can also pair it with curd to lower down the spice of this dish.

steps.to_do: First to make a dough take some wheat flour and knead it with water. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
Till then for the filling, grate some paneer, add chopped ginger, garlic, one spoon of mixed achaar and salt according to taste.
Mix these well till the flavours combine.
Then roll out your dough and fill the stuffing in between.
Close the dough and roll it out again.
Then heat a pan and bake your achari paneer paratha on medium to high flame till the crust becomes crispy.

title: Kashmiri Roti Recipe
description: This fluffy and soft bread is usually cooked in an underground tandoor and enjoyed with tea. But since most of us won’t have the facility of a tandoor, we bring you a simpler version to make this roti easily at your home.

steps.to_do: In a Katori, mix yeast and water and set it aside for 10 minutes.
Then take a bowl and add flour, salt and baking soda. Mix it well together.
Add ghee and yoghurt and combine to form a soft dough.
Then put in the yeast and water mix. When the dough is ready, brush it with some oil and keep it aside for three hours.
When the dough rises because of the yeast, knead it for another minute and roll it out in the form of a roti.
Preheat the oven to a high temperature and put in your roti.
Before that, brush it with milk and sprinkle poppy seeds on top.
Place it on the preheated tray, and cook on medium heat for about 3-4 minutes.
Cook till the roti is golden brown.

title: Lychee Rabri Kulfi Recipe
description: This extraordinary combination of kulfi and rabri along with flavours of lychee tastes heavenly.

steps.to_do: Peel and deseed Lychees.
In a mixture grind and make a fine paste and strain.
Now finely chop half of them and keep aside. Then peel and fine chop all the dry fruits
Heat milk in a heavy bottom kadai and keep stirring, boil till reduce to half.
Now add grated Khoya and cook for 2-3 minutes and then add Lychee juice.
Now add sugar all dry fruits and kewra water drops stir and cook it for another 2/3 minutes and make it cool.
When cold add chopped Lychee and mix well.
Transfer this mixture into kulfi moulds and keep in freezer to set.
Serve chilled.

title: Chilli Parotta Recipe
description: Parotta is a famous flatbread from South India which is made with all-purpose flour/maida. However, this desi chinese version of parotta is a combination of garlic and other vegetables like capsicum, onion followed by sauces like chilli sauce and soy sauce.

steps.to_do: Cut your parotta in bite size pieces and fry them lightly in a pan.
Then remove it, add some oil and fry the garlic till golden brown.
To this add the chopped onion, capsicum and cabbage. Cook on medium flame for two-three minutes.
Next put in your masalas, soy sauce and red chilli sauce according to taste.
Mix it well and the throw in the parotta pieces.
Stir this well and cook for another five minutes on medium heat.
Then serve it in a bowl and garnish with spring onions.

title: Paal Poli Recipe
description: Paal Poli is an authentic South Indian dessert made with deep fried semolina puri soaked in sweet saffron milk.

steps.to_do: First, mix maida, suji, half of your sugar, a pinch of salt, some water and knead a soft dough.
Let this dough rest for at least 10 mins.

In a pan boil milk and let it thicken, after a while add saffron threads and sugar and simmer for another 5 mins. Sprinkle the cardamom powder and once that is properly dissolved, remove it off the heat.
Prepare the dry fruits mixture by coarsely grinding the almond and cashew and sugar. Keep this aside for later.
Now, take your dough and roll tiny balls out of it, make tiny puris and fry them.
Dip all of your fried puris in the flavoured milk.
Plate the dessert by placing puris, pouring the flavoured milk on top and garnishing with the dry fruits mixture.

title: Chicken Salna Recipe
description: Chicken Salna is a well-known street side dish in southern parts of Tamil Nadu. Simple, quick and easy-to-make, salna is a thin gravy usually made with mutton or chicken stock along with other flavourful spices.

steps.to_do: Heat oil in a pan, add coconut, peanuts along with dry ingredients like fennel seeds, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon and pepper corn.
Roast all the spices on low flame for 2-3 minutes. Once done, blend them in a blender by adding water as required to make a consistent paste. (when cool down).
Now heat oil in another pan again, add sliced onions, curry leaves along with ginger garlic paste and salt to taste.
Saute for few minutes until onions get transculent and soft.
Now, add in chopped tomatoes and cover the lid until tomatoes get soft and juiced down.
Add curry powder (optional) along with red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and salt to taste.
Then add chicken pieces and mix everything so well.
Add water and cover the lid for 15-20 minutes and keep stirring meanwhile to avoid burning.
Add coriander leaves and mint leaves to garnish.
Serve it hot with parotta, rice or idli.

title: Paneer Do Pyaza Recipe
description: Paneer do pyaza is a very popular vegetarian recipe from north India. It is prepared by using paneer chunks dipped into a luscious and spicy gravy.

steps.to_do: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, cardamom, green chillies and let it splutter.
Now add, ginger garlic paste and onion paste. Cook until onion paste gets little brownish in colour.
Add tomato puree and cook for 3-5 minutes. Then add salt, coriander powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder and saute for a minute.
Add water and cook for 5-6 minutes.
Add cubed onions and paneer into the gravy, cover the lid and cook for 5 mins again.
Now add kasoori methi and mix well.
Garnish it with coriander leaves and serve hot with chapatis!

title: Goli Idli Recipe
description: Rice balls steamed, cooked and served with your favorite tomato chutney. This innovative goli idli recipe is so easy to make and requires just a few ingredients.
ingredients: 1 and a half tsp Chana dal

steps.to_do: Boil water in a pan, add salt and ghee. Now, add rice flour, and let the water completely soak in.
Let it cool down a little and then make soft dough. Add hot water if required.
Make small balls out of the dough and steam them for 10-15 minutes.
Heat oil in another pan, add urad dal, chana dal, mustard seeds, green chilli, curry leaves, sesame seeds and ginger. Let them splutter for 2-3 minutes.
Add idli and mix it well with the mixture.
Garnish with coriander leaves and enjoy!

title: Nadan Kozhi Curry Recipe
description: Nadan Kozhi Curry is a traditional Kerala-style chicken curry which is made with succulent chicken chunks simmered in flavourful coconut oil or milk followed by some aromatic lightly roasted spices.

steps.to_do: Grind ginger garlic paste, green chilies and curry leaves along with onion in the blender. Do not completely blend it.
Heat oil in a kadhai and add the blended mixture with salt, saute well until golden brown. It will take at least 20-25 minutes approximately.
Add turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala powder and coriander powder. Saute for about 5 – 6 minutes or until their raw smell leaves.
Add chopped tomato pieces. Saute really well until tomato gets mashed up completely and oil separates.
Add 1/4 cup hot water. Mix well. Add the chicken pieces, salt as required and mix everything well so that the chicken gets well-coated with the gravy.
Cover it until the chicken pieces get tender.
Now in a separate pan, add coconut oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves and let them splutter. Pour this on the top of the curry and cover it for 10 minutes.
Serve with your favourite bread or rice. Enjoy!

title: Nilakadalai Chutney Recipe
description: Nilakadalai Chutney, also known as peanut chutney is a delicious blend of flavours of peanut, coconut and curry leaves. This chutney can be a perfect companion to enhance the taste and flavours of your usual food.

steps.to_do: Heat a pan and roast the peanuts for 10 minutes.
Let it cool down and remove the skin from the peanuts.
Then add one tablespoon oil into the pan, thrown in garlic, red chilli and onions.
Sautee it till the onions turn soft.
Then add the tamarind, salt and jaggery. Let it cook for a minute.
In a blender add your peanuts, coconut powder and the prepared mix. Blend it till a smooth paste is formed. Take it out in a bowl.
Then make some tadka using oil, red chilli, curry leaves and pour on top of the chutney.

title: Chicken Keema Idli Recipe
description: Chicken keema is an ultimate non-vegetarian inclusion to the South Indian cuisine list. This recipe is not just unique but also quite healthy.

steps.to_do: Blend soaked dal, rice and salt together in a blender
Heat oil in a pan, then add cumin seeds. Once the seeds splutter, add onions and cook until brown.
Add green chillies and ginger garlic paste and keep stirring the mixture.
Add all the spices turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala and cumin powder.
Add tomatoes and some water. Mash them together and let them cook until smooth gravy.
Add chicken mince and combine it with the spices properly. Let it cook for some time.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and allow the keema to cool.
Grease idli maker moulds with oil and pour one layer of idli batter in the idli maker mould.
Add chicken keema on top of the first layer.
Add the second layer of batter over the keema and steam the idlis for 10-15 minutes.
Serve it hot with coconut chutney and sambhar.
